{{multiple issues| {{primary sources|date=April 2013}} {{self-published|date=April 2013}} {{technical|date=April 2013}} {{third-party|date=April 2013}} }} {{Infobox company | company_name = MarkLogic Corporation| company_logo = [[File:Marklogic-logo.PNG|221px|MarkLogic]] | </gallery> | company_type = Private | foundation = [[San Mateo, California]] (2001) | location = San Carlos, California | key_people = Gary Bloom, CEO Christopher Lindblad, co-founder | industry = [[Software]]| products = MarkLogic Server; | num_employees = 250| homepage = [http://www.marklogic.com/ www.marklogic.com] }} '''MarkLogic''' is a [[United States|American]] software business that makes a [[NoSQL]] database. The company is headquartered in Silicon Valley with field offices in Washington D.C., New York, London, Frankfurt, Tokyo, and Austin, TX.
==History== The company was founded in 2001 by Christopher Lindblad,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.crunchbase.com/person/christopher-lindblad |title=Christopher Lindblad |publisher=CrunchBase}}</ref> chief architect of the Ultraseek search engine at Infoseek, and Paul Pedersen, a professor of computer science at Cornell and UCLA, to address the emergence of [[XML]] as a document markup standard and [[XQuery]] as the standard means for accessing collections of XML documents up to tens or hundreds of terabytes in size.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsbreaks.infotoday.com/NewsBreaks/MarkLogic--Introduces-Stable-of-New-Features-for-the-XML-Server-51064.asp |title=MarkLogic 4.0 Introduces Stable of New Features for the XML Server |publisher=Information Today |date= 2008-10-09}}</ref>
In May 2012 Gary Bloom joined MarkLogic as Chief Executive Officer.
MarkLogic is privately held and backed by [[Sequoia Capital]] and [[Tenaya Capital]].
==Technology==
===MarkLogic Server===
The companyâ€™s main product, MarkLogic Server, is an XML based database management server.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.crunchbase.com/company/marklogic |title=MarkLogic |publisher=CrunchBase}}</ref> It is the most popular native [[XML databases|XML DBMS]] as of April 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://db-engines.com/en/ranking/native+xml+dbms |title=DB-Engines Ranking of Native XML DBMS |publisher=DB-Engines}}</ref>
===MarkMail=== MarkMail, which makes heavy use of MarkLogic Server, is a free public mailing list archive service that emphasizes interactivity and search analytics. Every search result shows a histogram traffic chart of the messages matching the query, and also the top matching lists and senders.
MarkMail started in November 2007 with approximately 4 million email messages. As of 10th December 2012, the service claims inclusion of 60,507,424 messages across 8,623 lists, of which 3,069 are active lists.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://markmail.org/browse |title=MarkMail list of lists}}</ref> The archive includes complete list histories for Apache, [[FreeBSD]], [[GNOME]], [[Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol|Jabber]], [[Java.net]], KDE, [[Mozilla]], [[MySQL]], [[OpenOffice.org]], Perl.org, [[PostgreSQL]], Python, Red Hat, Ruby, W3C, and Xen, among others.
